Functional components historically did’nt support state, but the intorduciton of hooks has changed this, if you are using new versions of react you may just want to use functional components, but older version will require you to use classes if you want to mange state. 

Class based

class XY extends Component
  • ​Access to state
  • Lifecycle Hooks
Access State and Props via “this”
this.state.XY & this.props.XY

Functional

const XY props => { … }
  • ​Access to State via Hooks (useState())
  • Lifecycle Hooks
Access Props via “props”
props.XY
